html.p: What: Structure a table of data for humans

ol.li: Table returns only the fields you specify
Cannot be used to rename fields. Which is a huge let-down, but no one seems interested in fixing it.
Use table at the end of your SPL; it can significantly impact performance when used too early!

html.p: Why: Sometimes people need to read data too!
So What: Make your results pretty, and don't confuse it with fields.
We're using data we built earlier by using outputlookup. To build this see outputlookup
While yours may differ slightly, that data for us is:
Adding | table cars, salesperson to the end of the search.
Skipping more fields by just adding | table salesperson to the end of the search.

panel.html: Remember our fields example? Here we add a table and a fields command on one order:. index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd earliest=-1h | fields component group | table * | eval _raw=substr(_raw,1,50) | eval _raw=_raw . "..." Runs faster as its returning only 2 fields (plus _raw and _time). Note the eval's are there just to make it more readable.

search.query: index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd earliest=-1h | fields component group | table * | eval _raw=substr(_raw,1,50) | eval _raw=_raw . "..."

panel.html: Now let's flip the table and a fields: index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd earliest=-1h | table * | fields component group | eval _raw=substr(_raw,1,50) | eval _raw=_raw . "..." Runs slower showing only the same fields, but this time it did the work for *all* the fields and only threw them away at the very end. Note the eval's are there just to make it more readable.

search.query: index=_internal sourcetype=splunkd earliest=-1h | table *| fields component group | eval _raw=substr(_raw,1,50) | eval _raw=_raw . "..."
